source_sentence: 佛說貧窮老公經
translation: Foshuo fangfu zhihuo jing

source_sentence: 宋沙門釋慧簡譯
translation: Song Dynasty Translation by the ascetic Shi Huijian

source_sentence: 聞如是：一時，佛在舍衛國精舍中坐，與二千比丘俱。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at a monastery in Sāvatthī, accompanied by two thousand monks.

source_sentence: 時有一貧窮老公，年二百歲，眉生秀毛，耳出於頭，齒如齊貝，手過於膝，
translation: Then there was a poor old man, two hundred years old, with hair growing from his eyebrows and hair standing straight up at the top of his head. His teeth were like those of a seashell shell; his hands extended over his knees.

source_sentence: 貌而視之，似如有相。
translation: They looked as if they had the same marks.

source_sentence: 而貧窮辛苦，衣不蓋形，五體裸露，腹恒飢虛，行步時動，小有氣息，
translation: The poor and wretched suffer from hunger, their clothes don’t cover their bodies. They are naked in all five bodily parts and constantly hungry with hunger in the belly. Walking and walking move at the same time, little by little they may

source_sentence: 扶杖而來，求欲見佛。
translation: They came with their staffs and wished to see the Buddha.

source_sentence: 釋梵侍門，勅不通之。
translation: The Śākyamuni and Brahmā attendants ordered him not to allow them to do so.

source_sentence: 老公因大喚曰：「吾雖貧賤，民之廝下，千載有幸，今得值佛，欲問罪福，
translation: The old man cried out in a loud voice, saying, “Even though I am poor and humble among the common people, I have been fortunate for a thousand years. Now that I have met the Buddha, I wish to ask him about my sins and

source_sentence: 求離眾苦。
translation: They seek to be free of all suffering.

source_sentence: 我聞世尊仁慈普逮，萬物蒙賴，莫不受恩，是以遠來，乞一示見。
translation: I have heard that the World-honored One is universally benevolent and compassionate. All things depend on him, and no one does not accept his kindness. That is why I am coming from a great distance to ask you to show me your way.

source_sentence: 而卿斷我，既違我願，有誤聖意，豈宜可爾乎？」
translation: You've cut off me, and since you disobey my vow and have a mistake in the noble intention, how could that be possible?

source_sentence: 佛以知之，顧語阿難：「汝寧見長壽耆年有相老公，而罪未畢者乎？」
translation: Knowing this, the Buddha looked at Ānanda and said to him, Would you rather see a long-lived old man with characteristics who hasn't yet completed his crimes?

source_sentence: 阿難叉手白佛言：「安有相福耆壽，而有罹罪？
translation: Ānanda saluted the Buddha with his palms joined and said to him, Is there a mark of blessedness and longevity that commits sin?

source_sentence: 罹罪之人，豈復有相？
translation: How could a person who commits a sin have any other characteristic?

translation: Where is it now?

translation: It's not seen in birth.

translation: The Buddha said, They're near outside the gate.

translation: If Śākyamuni and Brahmā cut it off, he can be summoned to the front.

source_sentence: 於是，老公匍匐寸進，為佛作禮，悲喜交流，而白佛言：「我生世不幸，
translation: Then the old man prostrated himself one inch further to pay homage to the Buddha and said to him, “I am unfortunately born in this world.

source_sentence: 貧窮辛苦飢餓寒凍，求死不得，活無所賴，人命至重，不能自棄。
translation: The poor and wretched suffered from hunger, thirst, hunger, cold, and the cold. They could not escape death but lived on nothing to sustain themselves. Their human life was so great that they could not throw away their own bodies.

source_sentence: 聞佛在世，心獨歡喜，晝夜發心，願一奉顏，由來十年，今始得果。
translation: When he heard that the Buddha was living in the world, his mind rejoiced. Day and night he cherished the thought of enlightenment and vowed to pay homage to him once every ten years; but now he had just attained enlighten

source_sentence: 向在門外，久不得前。
translation: He had been outside the gate for a long time but could not go in front.

source_sentence: 計欲還去，氣力不堪，進退無路，但恐命絕，穢污聖門，重增其罪。
translation: Wishing to return or depart, he was overcome with energy and unable to do so. There was no way to advance or retreat but feared that his life might be cut off; this would pollute the holy gates and increase his transgression

source_sentence: 不悟天尊，已哀矜之，得蒙前進，不奪本願，如此而死，無復恨矣！
translation: Not realizing that the heavenly honored one had pity for him, he was allowed to advance and didn't take away his original vow, and died like this, no longer resenting it!

source_sentence: 惟欲速終畢罪，後世願得垂恩，施其上慧。」
translation: They simply want to quickly end their sins and wish to receive kindness in the afterlife and bestow superior wisdom on them.

source_sentence: 佛言：「人之受生，生死因緣，以多因緣，致有罪根。
translation: The Buddha said, A person's birth is the cause and condition for birth-and-death, and many causes and conditions give rise to the root of sin.

source_sentence: 今我為汝，說其本源。
translation: I will now explain the original source for you.

source_sentence: 卿前世時，生豪強大國明慧王家。
translation: In a previous life, you were born in the house of King Minghui of the powerful great kingdom of the country.

source_sentence: 時為太子，憍貴非凡，上為父母所愛，下為臣民所敬。
translation: At the time, he was a prince of great stature and noble people, loved by his parents and respected by his ministers.

source_sentence: 用此恣意，輕凌於人，高目大視，矜抗邈然，財寶億萬，皆是民物。
translation: As a result of this kindness, they despise the people and look down on them with lofty eyes. They are greedy and covetous and their property amounts to hundreds of thousands of myriads of koṭis of coins all belonging

source_sentence: 百姓貧弊，皆坐課歛，惟知聚積財物，不肯布施。
translation: The people were poor and impoverished, and they all sat in classes and collected their goods. They only knew that they had accumulated wealth but refused to give alms.

source_sentence: 「時有貧寒沙門，名曰靜志，從遠國來，故往詣卿，所求不多，惟法衣耳。
translation: At the time, there was a poor and cold ascetic named Jingzhi, who came from a distant land and therefore went to see you. All he asked for was nothing but religious robes.

source_sentence: 而卿了不當，接遇之甚惡，既不乞衣，又不與食，空坐著前，去復不聽。
translation: But you will not allow me to do so, and it will be a most unfortunate experience for you. If you don't beg for your robes or food, you'll sit empty-handedly in front of me, and I won't listen to

source_sentence: 晝夜七日，水漿永絕，亦有氣息，命在轉燭。
translation: For seven days and nights the water and juice were never supplied, and there was also a shortage of breath. Their life depended on the changing of the candle.

source_sentence: 而卿見此，方大歡喜，聚人看之，以為快樂。
translation: When you saw this, you were greatly delighted. All the people in the assembly looked at it and thought they were happy.

source_sentence: 邊有侍臣，而諫卿曰：『太子莫爾！
translation: An attendant minister by the side remonstrated with you, saying, 'That's not true, prince!'

source_sentence: 沙門慈恭，道德內合，凍之不寒、餓之不飢，所以來乞，欲為福耳。
translation: The śramaṇa Maitreya was compassionate and respectful, with a sense of morality that kept the frozen monks free from cold and the hungry from starving. For this reason he came to ask for almsfood in order to obtain blessedness

source_sentence: 既不施與，安可窮逼？
translation: If you don't give it, how can you be oppressed?

source_sentence: 幸發遣之，勿招其罪。』
translation: It's fortunate to send them away, so don't invite their sins.'

source_sentence: 「太子答曰：『此是何人，詐稱道德，試小困之。
translation: The prince answered, 'Who is this person who fraudulently praises his morality and tries to deceive him?'

source_sentence: 纔令不死。
translation: It only causes them not to die.

source_sentence: 正爾放去，無所憂也。』
translation: Just let him go, and there's nothing to worry about.'

source_sentence: 即便遣去驅逐出國。
translation: They were immediately expelled and driven out of the country.

source_sentence: 「未出國界，十餘里中，逢遭飢賊，欲殺噉之。
translation: Before leaving the frontier, more than ten li away, he met a hungry thief who wanted to kill him.

source_sentence: 沙門言曰：『我貧凍沙門，羸瘦骨立，肉既腥臊，不中噉也，空當見殺，
translation: The śramaṇa said, “I am a poor and frozen śramaṇa. My flesh is emaciated and my bones stand on end. Because of the foulsmelling taste of this flesh, I cannot eat it.

source_sentence: 而無所任。』
translation: There's nothing to be done.'

source_sentence: 「餓賊又曰：『我餓困累日，但食土耳，卿雖小瘦，故是肉也。
translation: Again, the hungry thief said, 'I've been hungry and destitute for a long time, but I've only eaten soil. Although you're small and thin, it's therefore flesh.

source_sentence: 終不相放，但當就死。』
translation: They won't let go of each other; they'll just die.'

source_sentence: 如此前却，紛紜良久。
translation: In this way, the matter has been in dispute for a long time.

source_sentence: 「太子得知，便往救曰：『我以不能乞其衣食，寧當復令賊殺之耶？』
translation: Knowing this, the prince went to rescue him, saying, 'Because I can't beg for his food and clothing, how could I let the thief kill him?'

source_sentence: 賊見太子，皆叩頭首過謝罪，放沙門去。
translation: When the thieves saw the prince, they bowed their heads and apologized for their sins and released the ascetic.

source_sentence: 「時沙門者，今彌勒菩薩是；
translation: “The śramaṇa of that time was Maitreya Bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 憍貴太子者，今卿是也。
translation: This is what you are now, prince of the arrogance.

source_sentence: 故卿今日受此貧窮之罪，坐慳貪也；
translation: That is why today you have suffered the punishment of being poor and miserable, sitting in a state of covetousness.

source_sentence: 所以得長壽者，救活沙門之命也。
translation: The reason they attain longevity is to save the life of the ascetics.

source_sentence: 罪福報應，亦如影響。」
translation: The karmic retribution of sin and merit is likewise as an effect.

source_sentence: 老公白佛：「去事已爾，願畢於今，乞得以垂殘之命，得作沙門，後生世世，
translation: The old man said to the Buddha, “After you leave here, may your wishes be fulfilled at this moment. Please grant me permission to pass away so that I can become a śramaṇa and be reborn in the human world.” The Buddha said:

source_sentence: 常侍佛邊。」
translation: He always attends the Buddha's side.

source_sentence: 佛言：「善哉！」
translation: The Buddha said, Good!

source_sentence: 應時，老公鬚髮墮地，法衣在身，體氣強健，耳目聰明，即得上慧，入三昧門。
translation: At that time the old man’s hair fell to the ground, and his religious robes remained on his body. His bodily energy was strong and his ears and eyes were intelligent. Then he attained supreme wisdom and entered the samādhi gate.

source_sentence: 「我昔為太子，　　不識仁義方，
translation: Formerly, when I was a prince, I did not know benevolence and Righteousness.

source_sentence: 憍貴自放恣，　　恃為大國王，
translation: They are arrogant and self-indulgent, Relying on themselves as kings of great countries.

source_sentence: 自謂無罪福，　　此以可保常。
translation: They say they have no faults or merits, but this is because they can be preserved eternally.

source_sentence: 豈悟生死對，　　於今受其殃？
translation: Doesn't he realize that birth and death are opposed, and now he's subject to their misfortune?

source_sentence: 從罪復蒙福，　　得覩天中天，
translation: From sin, they'll again attain merit, and they'll be reborn in the Heaven of Deceitlessness.

source_sentence: 能脫既往罪，　　垂命入法門，
translation: Being freed from past sins, they'll be allowed to enter the Dharma teaching with their lives.

source_sentence: 永離慳貪心，　　長受智慧根，
translation: Being forever free of the mind of stinginess and greed, they’ll long experience the faculty of wisdom.

source_sentence: 世世侍佛邊，　　保持萬劫存。」
translation: By the side of worldly attendants and buddhas, they'll keep it alive for a thousand eons.

source_sentence: 以偈讚佛：於是老公比丘，說是偈已，禮佛而去。
translation: He praised the Buddha in verse: The old monk then, having uttered these verses, venerated the Buddha and departed.
